description: This file appears to be a C source file implementing utility functions for reading and parsing configuration files, handling MAC and hexadecimal conversions, and managing parameter linked lists, within a network device or system context.

methods.name: int file_parse(char * file_name,param_node ** head)
methods.description: Parses a configuration file to extract key-value parameter pairs into a linked list, handling specific cases for MAC address filtering.

methods.name: void free_paramList(param_node * head)
methods.description: Frees the linked list of parameters to prevent memory leaks.

methods.name: int getMac(char * macAddress,int len,unsigned char * mac)
methods.description: Converts a MAC address string into a byte array.

methods.name: int getHex(char * hex_val,unsigned char * hexVal,int hexLen)
methods.description: Converts a hexadecimal string into a byte array, with specific formatting for 8-byte values.

methods.name: int getHexGeneric(char * hex_val,unsigned char * hexVal,int hexLen)
methods.description: Converts a generic hexadecimal string into a byte array.

ctags.name: getMac
ctags.pattern: /^int getMac(char * macAddress, int len, unsigned char * mac)$/
